pullRequest.title: Provide a way to consume headers and data separately from HttpResponse
pullRequest.bodyText:
Motivation:
HttpResponse publishes HTTP headers and payloads in a single Publisher.
When subscribing HttpResponse, users should distinguish HttpHeaders and HttpData manually.
The single stream is also inconvenient when integrating Armeria clients with others.
Some clients only take pre-materialized headers and body stream.
ArmeriaHttpClientResponseSubscriber is a example.
https://github.com/line/armeria/blob/fbe90f0f2a952578012a552c26b3f4f8bdb33c8c/spring/boot2-webflux-autoconfigure/src/main/java/com/linecorp/armeria/spring/web/reactive/ArmeriaHttpClientResponseSubscriber.java#46
Modifications:

Add HttpResponse.split() method to HttpResponse for easily spliting HTTP headers and body.
Introduce SplitHttpResponse that separately hold HTTP headers and body.
Add DefaultSplitHttpResponse that provide default implementation for SplitHttpResponse.
Move NoopSubscription to internal.commmon.stream from common.stream.
Migrate ArmeriaHttpClientResponseSubscriber into ArmeriaHttpResponseBodyStream and make it extend DefaultSplitHttpResponse.

Result:
You can now split HTTP headers from HttpResponse convenientely using HttpResponse.split()

commit.message:
Provide a way to consume headers and data separately from HttpResponse

Motivation:

`HttpResponse` publishes HTTP headers and payloads in a single `Publisher`.
When subscribing `HttpResponse`, users should distinguish `HttpHeaders` and HttpData manually.
The single stream is also inconvenient when integrating Armeria client with others.
Some clients only takes pre-materialized headers and body stream.
`ArmeriaHttpClientResponseSubscriber` is a example.
https://github.com/line/armeria/blob/fbe90f0f2a952578012a552c26b3f4f8bdb33c8c/spring/boot2-webflux-autoconfigure/src/main/java/com/linecorp/armeria/spring/web/reactive/ArmeriaHttpClientResponseSubscriber.java#46

Modifications:

- Add `HttpResponseBodyStream` that publishes `HttpData` and completes `HttpHeaders` using `CompletableFuture`
- Add `HttpResponse.toBodyStream` for easy conversion.

Result:

You can now split HTTP headers from `HttpResponse` convenientely using `HttpResponse.toBodyStream`

TODO:
- Migrate ArmeriaHttpClientResponseSubscriber to use `HttpResponse.toBodyStream`

nodes.bodyText: I think we can remove this line not to access the memory when the httpObject is not an instance of ResponseHeaders
Can't this be just response.isEmpty()?
If subscribed with SubscriptionOptions.NOTIFY_CANCELLATION, the subscriber doesn't get notified because of this logic? Could you add a test for this?
How about doing this after downstreamUpdater.compareAndSet(this, null, downstream)?
Isn't this if (notifyCancellation) ?

I'm not sure we need to accept SubscriptionOption here. A user will have to specify them when retrieving the response body via SplitHttpResponse.body(). Otherwise, a user will have to specify the same option twice.
We could subscribe to HttpResponse with both SubscriptionOptions enabled internally, and then emulate the desired behavior based on what's specified in body.subscribe(), e.g.

Convert off-heap HttpData into heap HttpData if WITH_POOLED_OBJECTS option is off.
Propagate CancelledSubscriptionException to onError() only when NOTIFY_CANCELLATION option is on.
